Russia should not have free and unlimited access to America’s economy.

To ramp up the economic pressure on Putin, Congress must end Permanent Normal Trade Relations with Russia.

Twelve years after we passed the Affordable Care Act, its legacy is clear:

Sadly, the American people will be denied an experienced public servant who was ready to stand up for workers and Main Street.

Too many of my colleagues ignored Sarah Bloom Raskin's broad, bipartisan support and fell for talking points written by the oil and gas industry.

On #EqualPayDay, platitudes aren't enough—let's be clear about who's taking action.

Senate Democrats introduced legislation to close the #WageGap, and close loopholes that let employers pay women less.

Every Senate Republican voted against it.

We must repeal GPO and WEP.

More than 2 million Americans—many of whom are teachers, police officers, and other public servants—have their retirement benefits unfairly cut due to these harmful policies.

One year ago today, President Biden signed the #AmericanRescuePlan into law.
 
Without a single vote from Republicans, we passed the biggest tax cut for working families—EVER—
and saved pensions for over one million retirees from devastating cuts.
 
Our work continues.

Tonight, Ohioans heard the most pro-worker president in our lifetime reaffirm his commitment to put workers at the center of our economy. #SOTU

I was glad to welcome Danielle Robinson, a fierce advocate for Ohio veterans, to Washington today, as Dr. Biden’s #SOTU guest.

Ms. Robinson is the widow of Heath Robinson, an Ohio veteran who was exposed to burn pits while deployed, and who passed away in May 2020. https://t.co/CQiVV7dDQj
You’re damn right we’re burying the term "Rust Belt," @POTUS. #SOTU https://t.co/RINvdJI8kJ

President Biden has united the free world against Russia’s invasion.

Tonight, members of both parties are standing together in solidarity with the people of Ukraine. #SOTU

At Tonight’s #SOTU , I’ll be wearing this tie and ribbon in solidarity with Ukraine and its people. 

The Ukrainian people have showed incredible bravery and resolve. 

We stand with them. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/3PdpJ0OvYZ
Happy #StatehoodDay to the greatest state in our union 🎉 Every day, I'm proud to serve my home and the people of Ohio in the U.S. Senate. https://t.co/CRGzXnlZ8A

#WomensHistoryMonth is a time to celebrate the trailblazing women in Ohio and across our nation who came before us, and those who are forging new trails today.

Women aren’t a footnote to history—they’re inseparable from it. https://t.co/Hf54Sk14mG

As a nation, we must do our part to protect Ukrainians in the U.S. right now.
 
My colleagues and I are calling on @POTUS to extend Temporary Protected Status (TPS) to Ukraine—
 
to ensure no Ukrainians are forced to return to a war zone. https://t.co/qb2tnoa7x7

In the coming years, the Supreme Court is set to make decisions on everything from Ohioans’ health care to their right to vote. 

I’m confident that Judge Jackson understands that a commitment to our constitution requires standing up for civil rights, and standing up for workers.

Ketanji Brown Jackson has the experience, the character, and the commitment to justice needed to be an excellent Supreme Court Justice. 

As the first Black woman nominated to serve on the Court, she brings diverse experiences that have long been lacking from our highest court. https://t.co/TPzw97lGIq

Now is not the moment for partisan division.

Americans stand united with all our NATO allies, and we pray for the people of Ukraine.

President Biden has made it clear the U.S. and our allies and partners will impose the strongest sanctions Russia has ever seen, and I will work with the Biden Administration to implement them against Russian officials and oligarchs who prop up Putin’s regime.

Russia’s unprovoked assault on Ukraine is an affront to freedom the world over.

This attack will be met with decisive action by the U.S. and our allies.

Vladimir Putin chose war, he is unleashing senseless destruction on the Ukrainian people, and he will face the consequences.

Finally, the President is right to work with allies on a united response.

Sanctions imposed with our allies will pack a much bigger punch than U.S. sanctions alone.

President Biden and the international community should use all of the diplomatic, financial and economic tools available to forcefully address this act of aggression and ensure the security of the people of Ukraine.

I have worked with my colleagues to ensure the President has the tools to sanction Russia’s leaders, its banking and finance sectors, and other critical industries.

Now is the time to begin using these tools, to show Putin the consequences Russia will suffer from his actions.

Russia’s military incursion into eastern Ukraine is an act of naked aggression against the Ukrainian people and Ukrainian sovereignty that violates international law.

President Biden should begin to impose the punishing sanctions he has prepared, including against Putin himself.

Republicans are obstructing the most important nominees we can confirm right now to fight inflation.
 
Every @SenateBanking Democrat was ready today to get our Federal Reserve Board nominees on the job—
 
Republicans didn't show up. https://t.co/DSdpkbQChx
The picture says it all. https://t.co/pBRU6TXgSU

Today, @BankingGOP Republicans have chosen to abdicate their duty to the American people.

End the theatrics and show up to do your jobs. #FedFiveNow
https://t.co/x6nDlTdtg9

President Biden has selected five qualified nominees for the Federal Reserve.
 
Together, they will rein in Wall Street and fight for workers.
 
Let's get these nominees confirmed. #FedFiveNow
https://t.co/6aa1j8QF5D

Stopped by the West 6th Street Starbucks in Cleveland today to support the workers unionizing.

These Ohioans are doing what generations of workers have done in our state—banding together to advocate for themselves and have a voice on the job. https://t.co/G89oR81wqt

Congratulations to Ohioan @MadiHubbell on taking home the Ice Dancing Bronze and making all of Sylvania and Ohio proud. 🙌 #TeamUSA
https://t.co/dcf6IwAahy

It was an unforgettable run. Proud of the @Bengals for an amazing season, and for bringing together so many Ohioans.

@SenAlexPadilla, looks like I owe you some @graeters ice cream.

No matter how you feel about football or the Superbowl, this is worth celebrating.
 
As a kid from Athens County, Burrow is using his platform to help families facing food insecurity in Southeast Ohio. Best of luck to him and the Bengals on Sunday.
https://t.co/pUJCX7Bsj9

Mr. Morgan embodied the spirit of our great state—making things and innovating right here in Ohio.

Despite the discrimination he endured, he put his own life on the line to save his fellow Clevelanders, and improved safety for people around the world with his creations. https://t.co/ynFj5kNQuD

Despite his heroism, it took years for the city to recognize his crucial role in the rescue.

Even when orders for his life-saving smoke hoods came pouring in from fire departments across the country, many canceled their purchases when they realized the inventor was a Black man. https://t.co/kMamX7GiiI

In 1916, Cleveland workers drilling a tunnel under Lake Erie became trapped in toxic fumes following a huge gas explosion.

After two previous failed rescue attempts, Mr. Morgan and his brother stepped in, using his gas masks to rescue two workers and recover four bodies. https://t.co/4qP9s3YNfh

Today's Ohio #BlackHistory 🧵

Cleveland's own Garrett Morgan, a prolific African-American inventor. 

Most known for inventing the gas mask and traffic signal, and his heroic role in saving the lives of workers trapped underground. https://t.co/15eBPRFqpf

1⃣Evicted, by @just_shelter
2⃣The Color of Law, by Richard Rothstein

Two excellent books that inform my work as @SenateBanking and Housing Chairman. https://t.co/aSYTA0uUzb
https://t.co/DPhgNNTQIO

"Here’s the truth about inflation—companies love it.

In reality, companies aren’t being forced to raise prices because of inflation. They’re raising prices because they can.”

You have to watch this video from @dionrabouin. https://t.co/86n5AN9H3s

Let’s raise the stakes, @SenAlexPadilla. 

I know the Bengals will bring home a win for Ohio. If they don’t, I’ll treat you to Cincinnati’s very own @graeters ice cream. What’s your wager? #WhoDey #RuleItAll https://t.co/oINJUJmCWG

We owe it to our future generations to preserve America’s rich Black history.
https://t.co/PKHCI3G1kG

Jobs are up. Wages are up.

This is a workers' economy.

I fully support Congressional staff and their efforts to unionize. Honoring the Dignity of Work starts with honoring the rights of working people to start or join a union.

Our staffs serve constituents around the country, and they deserve to have a voice in their workplace.

January 24—My Democratic colleagues and I urge the administration to make over-the-counter COVID-19 tests free for Medicare recipients.
 
February 3—The Biden administration responds, promising free COVID-19 tests by early spring.
 
Delivering results.
https://t.co/dsdbSBDJO7

Pass the Innovation and Competition Act.

I’m confident President Biden will appoint a justice who will continue this legacy—someone who understands that a commitment to the constitution and to equal justice requires standing up for civil rights and standing up to corporations on behalf of all Americans.

Stephen Breyer dedicated his life to serving the American people. For nearly three decades, he was a trusted, thoughtful voice for justice on the Supreme Court.

He understood that Supreme Court justices serve the public—not powerful special interests.

Secretary Raimondo is right—the chips shortage is only going to get worse until we pass the China competition bill, which will boost Intel’s investment in semiconductor manufacturing in Ohio. https://t.co/Ztn2t9Kdb6

Imagine that—when we put money in the pockets of working families, not corporate executives, their lives get better.
https://t.co/UPOtQ0SqjK
